suggestions.reason: Omoplata and triangle are part of the classic triangle-armbar-omoplata chain from guard, sharing similar mechanics and entry positions.
Mount is one of the most common positions to set up and finish armbars from, directly relevant to armbar execution.
The source page explicitly states starting position is 'Side Control Top (S008)' making this the required prerequisite position.
Omoplata is most commonly executed from closed guard bottom, making this a primary starting position link
Modern Leg Lock Meta focuses on submission strategies and systems, making the terminal submission state directly relevant as the goal of these leg lock sequences.
Triangle Choke Back and Rear Naked Choke are both primary attacks from back control position and often used in combination when one is defended.
Outside Heel Hook is a terminal submission that leads directly to Won by Submission state when successfully applied
Rear naked choke is a primary crucifix submission and shares the same back attack context with verbal tap requirements.
Toe Hold is a terminal state that ends in submission, making this the natural endpoint relationship.
Front Headlock is the primary starting position for the Brabo Choke setup and should be linked as a prerequisite position.
Saddle (honey hole) is the most dangerous leg lock position requiring specific defensive protocols covered in this framework.
Peruvian Necktie is executed specifically from turtle top position, making this the primary setup position.
Estima Lock is a terminal submission that leads directly to Won by Submission state when successfully completed.
Armbar Control is the finishing position for the Armbar from Back submission and represents the control phase before applying the joint lock.
Twister Finish is executed from Truck Position, which is the prerequisite setup position for achieving Twister Control.
Guillotine choke is commonly applied from the front headlock position, making this a direct positional prerequisite.
The Americana from Side Control requires Side Control Top (S033) as the starting position, making this the fundamental prerequisite position.
Arm Triangle is most commonly set up from side control, making this a primary starting position.
Triangle from Back is a finishing submission that leads to this terminal state when successful
Far Side Armbar is explicitly listed as starting from Side Control, making this a direct position-to-submission relationship.
Kneebar from 50/50 is a finishing technique that leads directly to this terminal state upon successful completion.

instructions.task: Apply these wikilink suggestions to markdown files
reporting: Report line numbers where links added
